Title: Marengo, IL
Descriptive Text: McHenry County, 56 miles NW of the Loop. Originally called Pleasant Grove, the village was settled along the Galena–Chicago Road after 1835 and prospered with the coming of the Galena & Chicago Union Railroad in 1851. An important commercial center for area farmers, the com- munity incorporated as a village in 1857 and as a city in 1893. Slow but steady growth brought the population to 6,355 by 2000.
